definition: to freeze over (of water or land)
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: In short, pigs can fly, and hell really can freeze over.
sentences.chinese: 简单点说，猪也能飞了，地狱也封冻了。

sentences.english: The lake usually ices over by mid-January.
sentences.chinese: 这个湖通常到了一月中旬就封冻了。

sentences.english: The accuracy of two-point depth-averaged flow measurement for ice-covered river is investigated.
sentences.chinese: 对冬季封冻河道的二点测流法精度进行了理论分析。

sentences.english: The season of continuous melt ends with the first freeze event of the fall.
sentences.chinese: 持续的融化一直要持续到秋天封冻期的到来。

sentences.english: The frozen water surface will have to be picked up by hand.
sentences.chinese: 封冻水面必须用鹤嘴锄挖掘。

sentences.english: The Baltic was still frozen in May.
sentences.chinese: 波罗的海5月时仍然处在封冻状态。

sentences.english: That port is iced in during the winter.
sentences.chinese: 那个港口一到冬季就会封冻。

sentences.english: At seven, we reached the shore of a small frozen lake.
sentences.chinese: 七点钟，我们到达了一座封冻的小湖岸边。

sentences.english: The ship was frozen in as the ice thickened.
sentences.chinese: 冰结得越来越厚，船被封冻在里面。

sentences.english: Why the river is not frozen in such cold weathers still a question.
sentences.chinese: 为什么这条河在这么冷的天也不封冻还是一个问题。

sentences.english: Lakes of liquid methane on a moon that resembles early Earth in deep freeze.
sentences.chinese: 卫星上有着液态沼气湖，类似早期封冻的地球。

sentences.english: Based on the supplying resources, ground water was considered as the primary resource to the main runoff in the freezing period.
sentences.chinese: 封冻期径流成分按补给来源分主要以地下水补给为主。

sentences.english: At that time, the frozen period around Beijing was 50 days longer than that at present.
sentences.chinese: 当时北京附近的运河封冻期也比现在长50天左右。

sentences.english: In the city the lakes freeze over as well.
sentences.chinese: 在市内，大小湖泊也全面封冻了。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
ice-jam flood (arising when river downstream freezes more than upstream)
